* the trade is (`tradeId`), which is unique between all instruments, but is not guaranteed to be strictly sequential.
* the trade sequence (`tradeSeq`), which starts at 1 for each instruments, and is strictly sequential. Under rare circumstances, it is possible for the trade sequence to skip a few numbers.

Signals the Websocket connection to send and request heartbeats. Heartbeats can be used to detect stale connections.
When heartbeats have been set up, the API server will send `heartbeat` messages and `test_request` messages. Your software should respond to `test_request` messages by sending a `/api/v2/public/test` request. If your software fails to do so, the API server will immediately close the connection. If your account is configured to cancel on disconnect, any orders opened over the connection will be cancelled.

parameters.description: The heartbeat interval in seconds, but not less than 10
parameters.name: interval

parameters.name: scope

get.description: Retrieve an Oauth access token, to be used for authentication of 'private' requests. Three methods of authentication are supported: - password - using email and and password as when logging on to the website - client_credentials - using the access key and access secret that can be found on the API page on the website - client_signature - using the access key that can be found on the API page on the website and user generated signature. The signature is calculated using some fields provided in the request, using formula described here [Deribit signature credentials](#additional-authorization-method-deribit-signature-credentials) - refresh_token - using a refresh token that was received from an earlier invocation The response will contain an access token, expiration period (number of seconds that the token is valid) and a refresh token that can be used to get a new set of tokens.
get.summary: Authenticate
Creates deposit address in currency

subscriptions.introduction:
#Subscriptions The [subscribe](#private-subscribe) method can be used to subscribe to one or more *channels*. This section provides an overview of the channels and the notifications that the subscriber will receive for each of those channels. In most cases the channel name is constructed from a couple of elements. This makes it possible to specify exactly which information is required, and/or the frequency or aggregation level. These elements are considered parameters for the subscription. For example, when subscribing to the channel book.BTC-27JUL18.10.20.100ms, the element BTC-27JUL18 specifies that the name of the instrument (see [naming](#naming)), 10 means that the results should be grouped to that precision, etc. As described in [notifications](#notifications), response data includes fields required by JSON-RPC and part dedicated for subscription data.

Name Type Description
jsonrpc string The JSON-RPC version (2.0)
method string Here it's always subscription
params object
    channel string The same channel as given when subscribing to notifications
    data object Data specific for the channel

For all the following channel types only specific data part will be described.

estimated_expiration_price.{index_name}.description: Returns calculated (estimated) ending price for given index.

book.{instrument_name}.{interval}.description:
Notifies about changes to the order book for a certain instrument.

The first notification will contain the whole book (bid and ask amounts for all prices). After that there will only be information about changes to individual price levels.

The first notification will contain the amounts for all price levels (list of ['new', price, amount] tuples). All following notifications will contain a list of tuples with action, price level and new amount ([action, price, amount]). Action can be either new, change or delete.

Each notification will contain a change_id field, and each message except for the first one will contain a field prev_change_id. If prev_change_id is equal to the change_id of the previous message, this means that no messages have been missed.

The amount for perpetual and futures is in USD units, for options it is in corresponding cryptocurrency contracts, e.g., BTC or ETH.

parameters.description: Frequency of notifications. Events will be aggregated over this interval.
parameters.name: interval

book.{instrument_name}.{interval}.summary: Notifies about changes to the order book for a certain instrument.

perpetual.{instrument_name}.{interval}.summary: Provide current interest rate - but only for **perpetual** instruments. Other types won't generate any notification.

user.trades.{instrument_name}.{interval}.summary: Get notifications about user's trades in an instrument.

user.orders.{kind}.{currency}.{interval}.summary: Get notifications about changes in user's orders in instruments of given kind and currency.

deribit_price_ranking.{index_name}.description: Provides information about current value (price) for stock exchanges used to calculate Deribit Index

book.{instrument_name}.{group}.{depth}.{.description:
Notifies about changes to the order book for a certain instrument.

Notifications are sent once per specified interval, with prices grouped by (rounded to) the specified group, showing the complete order book to the specified depth (number of price levels).

The 'asks' and the 'bids' elements in the response are both a 'list of lists'. Each element in the outer list is a list of exactly two elements: price and amount.

*price* is a price level (USD per BTC, rounded as specified by the 'group' parameter for the susbcription).

*amount* indicates the amount of all orders at price level. For perpetual and futures the amount is in USD units, for options it is amount of corresponding cryptocurrency contracts, e.g., BTC or ETH.

parameters.summary: Group prices (by rounding). Use 'none' for no grouping.
parameters.description: Group prices (by rounding). Use none for no grouping.
parameters.name: group

parameters.description: Number of price levels to be included.
parameters.name: depth

parameters.description: Frequency of notifications. Events will be aggregated over this interval.
parameters.name: interval

book.{instrument_name}.{group}.{depth}.{.summary: Aggregated notifications about changes to the order book for a certain instrument.

user.orders.{instrument_name}.{interval}.summary: Get notifications about changes in user's orders for given instrument.

trades.{instrument_name}.{interval}.summary: Get notifications about trades for an instrument.

user.portfolio.{currency}.description: Provides information about current user portfolio

user.trades.{kind}.{currency}.{interval}.summary: Get notifications about user's trades in any instrument of given kind in given currency.

announcements.summary: General announcements concerning the Deribit platform.

deribit_price_index.{index_name}.description: Provides information about current value (price) for Deribit Index

initial_margin.description: Initial margin of order, in base currency

selfTrade.description: true if the trade is against own order. This can only happen when your account has self-trading enabled. Contact an administrator if you think you need that.

tradeSeq.description: Trade sequence number for the instrument

result.description: Object with instrument names as keys and two elements arrays as value. First element in array is mark price and second one is iv.

scope.description: Type of the access for assigned token

refresh_token.description: Can be used to request a new token (with a new lifetime)

session_profit_loss.description: total value of session profit and losses (in base currency)

mark_price.description: mark price for at the settlement time (in quote currency; settlement and delivery only)

funding.description: funding (in base currency ; settlement for perpetual product only)

socialized.description: the amount of the socialized losses (in base currency; bankruptcy only)

session_bankrupcy.description: value of session bankrupcy (in base currency; bankruptcy only)

profit_loss.description: profit and loss (in base currency; settlement and delivery only)

index_price.description: underlying index price at time of event (in quote currency; settlement and delivery only)

session_tax.description: total amount of paid taxes/fees (in base currency; bankruptcy only)

session_tax_rate.description: rate of paid texes/fees (in base currency; bankruptcy only)

position.description: position size (in quote currency; settlement and delivery only)

lastUpdate.description: The timestamp (in ms) that the order was last updated

triggered.description: Whether the stop order has been triggered (Only for future stop orders)

filledQuantity.description: The number of contracts already filled

avgPrice.description: average fill price of the order

execInst.description: Defines trigger type, required for stop limit orders, possible values `"index_price"`, `"mark_price"`  (Only valid for stop orders)

implv.description: Option implied volatility in percent. (Only when `adv=implv`)

stopPx.description: stop price (Only for future stop orders)

max_show.description: Maximum quantity within an order to be shown to other customers, 0 for invisible order.

created.description: The timestamp (in ms) that the order was created

quantity.description: The number of contracts to be traded

quote_currency.description: The currency in which the instrument prices are quoted.

tick_size.description: specifies minimal price change and, as follows, the number of decimal places for instrument prices

is_active.description: Indicates if the instrument can currently be traded.

min_trade_amount.description: Minimum amount for trading. For perpetual and futures - in USD units, for options it is amount of corresponding cryptocurrency contracts, e.g., BTC or ETH.

creation_timestamp.description: The time when the instrument was first created (milliseconds)

expiration_timestamp.description: The time when the instrument will expire (milliseconds)

edp.description: Estimated delivery price for the currency. For more details, see Documentation > General > Expiration Price

ETH.description: The current index price for ETH-USD (only for selected currency == ETH)

BTC.description: The current index price for BTC-USD (only for selected currency == BTC)

underlying_index.description: Name of the underlying future, or `'index_price'` (options only)

volume.description: The total 24h traded volume (in base currency)

underlying_price.description: underlying price for implied volatility calculations (options only)

bid_price.description: The current best bid price, `null` if there aren't any bids

open_interest.description: The total amount of outstanding contracts in the corresponding amount units. For perpetual and futures the amount is in USD units, for options it is amount of corresponding cryptocurrency contracts, e.g., BTC or ETH.

estimated_delivery_price.description: Estimated delivery price, in USD (futures only). For more details, see Documentation > General > Expiration Price

last.description: The price of the latest trade, `null` if there weren't any trades

mid_price.description: The average of the best bid and ask, `null` if there aren't any asks or bids

interest_rate.description: Interest rate used in implied volatility calculations (options only)

ask_price.description: The current best ask price, `null` if there aren't any asks

low.description: Price of the 24h lowest trade, `null` if there weren't any trades

result.description: Object if address is created, null otherwise

iv.description: Option implied volatility for the price (Option only)

index_price.description: Index Price at the moment of trade

amount.description: Trade amount. For perpetual and futures - in USD units, for options it is amount of corresponding cryptocurrency contracts, e.g., BTC or ETH.

socialized.description: The amount of the losses socialized

profitLoss.description: profit and loss (settlement and delivery only)

markPrice.description: Mark price for at the time  (settlement and delivery only)

indexPrice.description: Underlying index price at time of event (settlement and delivery only)

body.description: The HTML body of the announcement

publication_time.description: The timestamp in ms at which the announcement was published

important.description: Whether the announcement is marked as important

id.description: A unique identifier for the announcement

lastUpdate.description: The timestamp (in ms) that the order was last updated

triggered.description: Whether the stop order has been triggered (Only for future stop orders)

filledQuantity.description: The number of contracts already filled

avgPrice.description: average fill price of the order

execInst.description: Defines trigger type, required for stop limit orders, possible values `"index_price"`, `"mark_price"`  (Only valid for stop orders)

implv.description: Option implied volatility in percent. (Only when `adv=implv`)

stopPx.description: stop price (Only for future stop orders)

max_show.description: Maximum quantity within an order to be shown to other customers, 0 for invisible order.

created.description: The timestamp (in ms) that the order was created

quantity.description: The number of contracts to be traded

direction.description: The direction of the position. Can be "buy" (long) or "sell" (short)

sizeBtc.description: position size in BTC (0 if currency <>`BTC`)

settlementPrice.description: The settlement price for the instrument

sizeCurrency.description: position size in the base currency for the instrument

currency.description: The base currency of the instrument

size.description: The position size in contracts. Can be negative (short) or positive (long)

openOrderMargin.description: The margin used to back the position

testnet.description: false for production server, true for test server

usDiff.description: Duration of the handling of the request, in microseconds

id.description: The id that was sent in the request

usOut.description: The timestamp (in microseconds) of sending of the response

usIn.description: The timestamp (in microseconds) of receipt of the request

min_confirmations.description: Minimum number of block chain confirmations before deposit is accepted.

min_withdrawal_fee.description: The minimum transaction fee paid for withdrawals

disabled_deposit_address_creation.description: False if deposit address creation is disabled

currency.description: The abbreviation of the currency. This abbreviation is used elsewhere in the API to identify the currency.

currency_long.description: The full name for the currency.

withdrawal_fee.description: The total transaction fee paid for withdrawals

confirmed_timestamp.description: The timestamp (seconds since the Unix epoch, with millisecond precision) of withdrawal confirmation, `null` when not confirmed

futures_session_rpl.description: Futures session realized profit and Loss

portfolio_margining_enabled.description: When `true` portfolio margining is enabled for user

futures_session_upl.description: Futures session unrealized profit and Loss

projected_maintenance_margin.description: Projected maintenance margin (for portfolio margining users)

available_withdrawal_funds.description: The account's available to withdrawal funds

options_session_rpl.description: Options session realized profit and Loss

options_session_upl.description: Options session unrealized profit and Loss

projected_initial_margin.description: Projected initial margin (for portfolio margining users)

is_password.description: `true` when password for the subaccount has been configured

login_enabled.description: Informs whether login to the subaccount is enabled

tfa_enabled.description: Whether the two factor authentication is enabled

receive_notifications.description: When `true` - receive all notification emails on the main email

calls_volume.description: Total 24h trade volume for call options. This is expressed in the base currency, e.g. BTC for `btc_usd`

puts_volume.description: Total 24h trade volume for put options. This is expressed in the base currency, e.g. BTC for `btc_usd`

futures_volume.description: Total 24h trade volume for futures. This is expressed in the base currency, e.g. BTC for `btc_usd`

result.description: Result of method execution. `ok` in case of success

seconds.description: Number of seconds till finalizing the nearest instrument

is_estimated.description: When `true` then prize is given as an estimated value, otherwise it's current index price

timeStamp.description: The timestamp of the trade in ms

iv.description: option implied volatility for the price (Options only)

lastUpdate.description: The timestamp (in ms) that the order was last updated

triggered.description: Whether the stop order has been triggered (Only for future stop orders)

filledQuantity.description: The number of contracts already filled

avgPrice.description: average fill price of the order

execInst.description: Defines trigger type, required for stop limit orders, possible values `"index_price"`, `"mark_price"`  (Only valid for stop orders)

implv.description: Option implied volatility in percent. (Only when `adv=implv`)

stopPx.description: stop price (Only for future stop orders)

max_show.description: Maximum quantity within an order to be shown to other customers, 0 for invisible order.

created.description: The timestamp (in ms) that the order was created

quantity.description: The number of contracts to be traded

items.description: The first notification will contain the amounts for all price levels (a list of ["new", price, amount] tuples). All following notifications will contain a list of tuples with action, price level and new amount ([action, price, amount]). Action can be 'new', 'change' or 'delete'.

The first notification will contain the amounts for all price levels (a list of ["new", price, amount] tuples). All following notifications will contain a list of tuples with action, price level and new amount ([action, price, amount]). Action can be 'new', 'change' or 'delete'.

settlementPrice.description: The settlement price for this instrument. Only when `state=open`

bidIv.description: (Only for option) implied volatility for best bid

max.description: (Only for futures) The maximum price for the future. Any buy orders you submit higher than this price, will be clamped to this maximum.

oid.description: (Only for options)The order id of an unfilled order you have at this price. This field only shows if you have an order at this price level, and the request has been [signed](rpc-authentication.md).

uIx.description: (Only for option) underlying future instrument name or `"index_price"`

uPx.description: (Only for option) underlying price used for ask/bid implied volatility

delta.description: (Only for options) The delta value for the option

tstamp.description: The order book timestamp in milliseconds

last.description: The price for the last trade

asks.description: The list of all asks, best ask first. See below for entry details

min.description: (Only for futures) The minimum price for the future. Any sell orders you submit lower than this price will be clamped to this minimum.

markIv.description: (Only for option) implied volatility for mark price

iR.description: (Only for option) Interest rate used for implied volatility calculations

bids.description: The list of all bids, best bid first. See below for entry details

mark.description: The mark price for the instrument

state.description: The state of the order book. Possible values are `"open"` and `"closed"`.

vega.description: (Only for option) The vega value for the option

theta.description: (Only for option) The theta value for the option

askIv.description: (Only for option) implied volatility for best ask

deliveryPrice.description: The settlement price for this instrument. Only when `state=closed`

gamma.description: (Only for options) The gamma value for the option

quantity.description: The total quantity of orders for this price level

is_password.description: `true` when password for the subaccount has been configured

tfa_enabled.description: Whether the two factor authentication is enabled

receive_notifications.description: When `true` - receive all notification emails on the main email

not_confirmed_email.description: New email address that has not yet been confirmed. This field is only included if `with_portfolio` == `true`.

login_enabled.description: Informs whether login to the subaccount is enabled

timeStamp.description: The timestamp of the trade in ms

iv.description: option implied volatility for the price (Options only)

tickDirection.description: Direction of the "tick". 0 = Plus Tick, 1 = Zero-Plus Tick, 2 = Minus Tick, 3 = Zero-Minus Tick

portfolio_margining_enabled.description: `true` when portfolio margining is enabled for user

futures_session_upl.description: Futures session unrealized profit and Loss

projected_maintenance_margin.description: Projected maintenance margin (for portfolio margining users)

available_withdrawal_funds.description: The account's available to withdrawal funds

username.description: Account name (given by user) (available when parameter `extended` = `true`)

futures_session_rpl.description: Futures session realized profit and Loss

options_session_rpl.description: Options session realized profit and Loss

deposit_address.description: The deposit address for the account (if available)

system_name.description: System generated user nickname (available when parameter `extended` = `true`)

options_session_upl.description: Options session unrealized profit and Loss

tfa_enabled.description: Whether two factor authentication is enabled (available when parameter `extended` = `true`)

projected_initial_margin.description: Projected initial margin (for portfolio margining users)

last_price.description: The price for the last trade

currency_with_any.description: Currency, i.e `"BTC"`, `"ETH"` or `"any"` if don't care

cumulative_amount.description: The cumulative amount of all orders up till given price

best_bid_price.description: The current best bid price, `null` if there aren't any bids

currency_amount.description: Amount of funds in given currency

trade_seq.description: The sequence number of the trade within instrument

trigger.description: Trigger type (Only for stop orders). Allowed values: `"index_price"`, `"mark_price"`, `"last_price"`.

currency_transaction_id.description: Transaction id in proper format for currency, `null` if id is not available

min_price.description: The minimum price for the future. Any sell orders you submit lower than this price will be clamped to this minimum.

best_bid_amount.description: It represents the requested order size of all best bids

currency_address.description: Address in proper format for currency

underlying_index.description: Name of the underlying future, or `index_price` (options only)

timestamp.description: The timestamp (seconds since the Unix epoch, with millisecond precision)

kind_with_any.description: Instrument kind, `"future"` or `"option"` or `"any"` if don't care

advanced.description: advanced type: `"usd"` or `"implv"` (Only for options; field is omitted if not applicable).

bid_iv.description: (Only for option) implied volatility for best bid

order_state_in_user_trade.description: order state, `"open"`, `"filled"`, `"rejected"`, `"cancelled"`, `"untriggered"` or `"archive"` (if order was archived)

average_price.description: Average fill price of the order

profit_loss.description: Profit and loss in base currency.

filled_amount.description: Filled amount of the order. For perpetual and futures the filled_amount is in USD units, for options - in units or corresponding cryptocurrency contracts, e.g., BTC or ETH.

best_ask_price.description: The current best ask price, `null` if there aren't any asks

filled_quantity.description: The number of contracts to be traded.

ask_iv.description: (Only for option) implied volatility for best ask

settlement_price.description: The settlement price for the instrument. Only when `state = open`

timestamp_for_book_notifications.description: The timestamp of last change (seconds since the Unix epoch, with millisecond precision)

best_ask_amount.description: It represents the requested order size of all best asks

delivery_price.description: The settlement price for the instrument. Only when `state = closed`

open_interest.description: The total amount of outstanding contracts in the corresponding amount units. For perpetual and futures the amount is in USD units, for options it is amount of corresponding cryptocurrency contracts, e.g., BTC or ETH.

mark_price.description: The mark price for the instrument

volume.description: volume during last 24h in base currency

mark_iv.description: (Only for option) implied volatility for mark price

theta.description: (Only for option) The theta value for the option

vega.description: (Only for option) The vega value for the option

gamma.description: (Only for option) The gamma value for the option

rho.description: (Only for option) The rho value for the option

delta.description: (Only for option) The delta value for the option

max_show.description: Maximum amount within an order to be shown to other traders, 0 for invisible order.

matching_id.description: Matching (taker) order id, `null` if it is not users order

transfer_type.description: Type of transfer: `user` - sent to user, `subaccount` - sent to subaccount

triggered.description: Whether the stop order has been triggered (Only for stop orders)

contract_size.description: Contract size, for futures in USD, for options in BTC.

transfer_other_side.description: For transfer from/to subaccount returns this subaccount name, for transfer to other account returns address, for transfer from other account returns that accounts username.

stop_price.description: stop price (Only for future stop orders)

tick_direction.description: Direction of the "tick" (`0` = Plus Tick, `1` = Zero-Plus Tick, `2` = Minus Tick, `3` = Zero-Minus Tick).

book_state.description: The state of the order book. Possible values are `open` and `closed`.

commission.description: Commission paid so far (in base currency)

max_price.description: The maximum price for the future. Any buy orders you submit higher than this price, will be clamped to this maximum.

amount.description: It represents the requested order size. For perpetual and futures the amount is in USD units, for options it is amount of corresponding cryptocurrency contracts, e.g., BTC or ETH.

underlying_price.description: Underlying price for implied volatility calculations (options only)

implied_volatility.description: Value of the volatility of the underlying instrument

interest_rate.description: Interest rate used in implied volatility calculations (options only)

quantity.description: The number of contracts to be traded.

timestamp.description: The timestamp of the last update from stock exchange

weight.description: The weight of the ranking given in percent

average_price_usd.description: Only for options, average price in USD

estimated_liquidation_price.description: Only for futures, estimated liquidation price

floating_profit_loss_usd.description: Only for options, floating profit or loss in USD

size.description: Position size for futures size in quote currency (e.g. USD), for options size is in base currency (e.g. BTC)

mark_price.description: Current mark price for position's instrument

average_price.description: Average price of trades that built this position

settlement_price.description: Last settlement price for position's instrument 0 if instrument wasn't settled yet

size_currency.description: Only for futures, position size in base currency

order_id.description: Id of the user order (maker or taker), i.e. subscriber's order id that took part in the trade

iv.description: Option implied volatility for the price (Option only)

fee.description: User's fee in units of the specified `fee_currency`

self_trade.description: `true` if the trade is against own order. This can only happen when your account has self-trading enabled. Contact an administrator if you think you need that

label.description: User defined label (presented only when previously set for order by user)

index_price.description: Index Price at the moment of trade

amount.description: Trade amount. For perpetual and futures - in USD units, for options it is amount of corresponding cryptocurrency contracts, e.g., BTC or ETH.

matching_id.description: Always `null`, except for a self-trade which is possible only if self-trading is switched on for the account (in that case this will be id of the maker order of the subscriber)

liquidity.description: Describes what was role of users order: `"M"` when it was maker order, `"T"` when it was taker order

is_liquidation.description: `true` if order was automatically created during liquidation

optional_start_seq.description: The sequence number of the first trade to be returned
optional_start_seq.name: start_seq

index_name.description: Index identifier, matches (base) cryptocurrency with quote currency
index_name.name: index_name

currency_with_any.description: The currency symbol or `"any"` for all
currency_with_any.name: currency

transfer_currency_amount.description: Amount of funds to be transferred
transfer_currency_amount.name: amount

end_timestamp.description: The most recent timestamp to return result for
end_timestamp.name: end_timestamp

optional_start_trade_id.description: The ID number of the first trade to be returned
optional_start_trade_id.name: start_id

order_label.description: user defined label for the order (maximum 32 characters)
order_label.name: label

edit_advanced_order_type.description: Advanced option order type. If you have posted an advanced option order, it is necessary to re-supply this parameter when editing it (Only for options)
edit_advanced_order_type.name: advanced

max_show.description: Maximum amount within an order to be shown to other customers, `0` for invisible order
max_show.name: max_show

optional_settlement_start_timestamp.description: The latest timestamp to return result for
optional_settlement_start_timestamp.name: search_start_timestamp

optional_end_seq.description: The sequence number of the last trade to be returned
optional_end_seq.name: end_seq

optional_include_old_trades.description: Include trades older than 7 days, default - `false`
optional_include_old_trades.name: include_old

optional_end_trade_id.description: The ID number of the last trade to be returned
optional_end_trade_id.name: end_id

trigger.description: Defines trigger type, required for `"stop_limit"` order type
trigger.name: trigger

advanced_order_type.description: Advanced option order type. (Only for options)
advanced_order_type.name: advanced

order_quantity.description: It represents the requested order size. For perpetual and futures the amount is in USD units, for options it is amount of corresponding cryptocurrency contracts, e.g., BTC or ETH
order_quantity.name: amount

optional_kind.description: Instrument kind, if not provided instruments of all kinds are considered
optional_kind.name: kind

reduce_only.description: If `true`, the order is considered reduce-only which is intended to only reduce a current position
reduce_only.name: reduce_only

tfa.description: TFA code, required when TFA is enabled for current account
tfa.name: tfa

start_timestamp.description: The earliest timestamp to return result for
start_timestamp.name: start_timestamp

subscription_interval.description: Frequency of notifications. Events will be aggregated over this interval. The value `raw` means no aggregation will be applied
subscription_interval.name: interval

optional_sorting.description: Direction of results sorting (`default` value means no sorting, results will be returned in order in which they left the database)
optional_sorting.name: sorting

stop_price.description: Stop price, required for stop limit orders (Only for stop orders)
stop_price.name: stop_price

edit_order_price.description:
The order price in base currency.

When editing an option order with advanced=usd, the field price should be the option price value in USD.

When editing an option order with advanced=implv, the field price should be a value of implied volatility in percentages. For example, price=100, means implied volatility of 100%
edit_order_price.name: price

order_price.description:
The order price in base currency (Only for limit and stop_limit orders)

When adding order with advanced=usd, the field price should be the option price value in USD.

When adding order with advanced=implv, the field price should be a value of implied volatility in percentages. For example, price=100, means implied volatility of 100%
order_price.name: price

optional_include_unfilled_orders.description: Include in result fully unfilled closed orders, default - `false`
optional_include_unfilled_orders.name: include_unfilled

post_only.description:
If true, the order is considered post-only. If the new price would cause the order to be filled immediately (as taker), the price will be changed to be just below the bid.

Only valid in combination with time_in_force=`"good_til_cancelled"`
post_only.name: post_only

currency_address_from_address_book.description: Address in currency format, it must be in address book
currency_address_from_address_book.name: address

time_in_force.description:
Specifies how long the order remains in effect. Default `"good_til_cancelled"`

  • `"good_til_cancelled"` - unfilled order remains in order book until cancelled
  • `"fill_or_kill"` - execute a transaction immediately and completely or not at all
  • `"immediate_or_cancel"` - execute a transaction immediately, and any portion of the order that cannot be immediately filled is cancelled
time_in_force.name: time_in_force

withdrawal_priority.description: Withdrawal priority, optional for BTC, default: `high`
withdrawal_priority.name: priority

optional_simple_order_type.description: Order type - limit, stop or all, default - `all`
optional_simple_order_type.name: type

optional_include_old_orders.description: Include in result orders older than 2 days, default - `false`
optional_include_old_orders.name: include_old

withdrawal_currency_amount.description: Amount of funds to be withdrawn
withdrawal_currency_amount.name: amount

tags.name: websocket_only
tags.description: Can only be used over websockets.

tags.name: public
tags.description: Public methods can be used without authentication.

tags.name: private
tags.description:
Private methods require authentication. All requests must include a valid OAuth2 token.

A token can be requested using the /public/auth method.

When using the websockets protocol, the token must be included as a parameter access_token in the message. When using REST (HTTP GET), the token may also be passed in the Authorization header.

tags.name: internal
tags.description: Not intended for public use; do not include in publicly available documentation.

tags.name: subscription_management
tags.description: Subscription works as [notifications](#notifications), so users will automatically (after subscribing) receive messages from the server. Overview for each channel response format is described in [subscriptions](#subscriptions) section.
